7.12.19  12:28 pm   Do you like driving, over other forms of transportation? Because like, I'd prefer to ride my bike places, because I don't need to be so extremely careful to not cause an accident and i can actually look around and see and hear and ENJOY my surroundings, whereas when I'm driving I'm locked in this bubble and I have to keep my eyes on the road or else I'll drift out of my lane and crash or something. It reminds of that one quote "The destination is less important than the trip to get there." Do you ever feel this way?

7.12.19  12:20 pm   hello bill. sorry if this is a stupid question, i'm not much of a music expert. but did you use multi layer vocals in chorus of 'la de da'? 

      it's so satisfying to listen, particularly "where did all the good times go/where did all the bad times roll/when did all the windmills start to turn so slow" parts. whole song is beautiful. i love it.

7.12.19  5:30 am   I've had a YouTube channel since 2007 that I infrequently upload videos to and ever since 2011 I've been saying "okay - I'm going to get my shit together and make all these videos I have ideas for and get on a consistent release schedule."  Every time I get my shit together, there's some major problem - like with an instrument, camera, software, or some other piece of gear.  

Lately, I've had the time and money to get shit together and ACTUALLY DO IT but I tell myself "oh, I can't speak in front of a camera until I can get over this bad episode of acne" or "I need to have this or that to make for an interesting shot".  I've realized that my problems are partially in my head and I've been making excuses, procrastinating, etc...  I know this is partially due to my anxiety problems - and I've heard friends (mostly actors) describe it as "being in your head".  

I say all that to tell you tha t your videos and audio recordings buried on your website that show a glimpse into your creative process - especially when you were starting with Vine - have really helped me and inspired me.  A lot of that stuff made me feel like I wasn't alone and crazy whenever I talk to myself about grand ideas in order to sort things out or I try to hype myself up to get some creative endeavor done.

Is there any advice you can impart that'll encourage me to do "the damn thing"?  Or could you explain how you came to figure out your "process" and how to quit procrastinating and making excuses?
